verses.verse: Elihu Exalts God’s Goodness Elihu continued and said:
“Bear with me a little, and I will show you, for I have yet something to say on God’s behalf.
(Job 8.3; 37.23) I will bring my knowledge from far away and ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
(Job 33.3; 37.16) For truly my words are not false; one who is perfect in knowledge is with you.
(Job 12.13; Ps 22.24) “Surely God is mighty and does not despise any; he is mighty in strength of understanding.
(Job 5.15; 8.22) He does not keep the wicked alive but gives the afflicted their right.
(Ps 33.18; 113.8) He does not withdraw his eyes from the righteous, but with kings on the throne he sets them forever, and they are exalted.
And if they are bound in fetters and caught in the cords of affliction,
(Job 15.25) then he declares to them their work and their transgressions, that they are behaving arrogantly.
(2 Kings 17.13; Job 33.16) He opens their ears to instruction and commands that they return from iniquity.
(Isa 1.19, 20) If they listen and serve him, they complete their days in prosperity and their years in pleasantness.
(Job 4.21; 15.22) But if they do not listen, they shall perish by the sword and die without knowledge.
(Rom 2.5) “The godless in heart cherish anger; they do not cry for help when he binds them.
(Job 15.32; 22.16) They die in their youth, and their life ends in shame. (Heb ends among the prostitutes)
(v 10|JOB 36:10; Ps 119.67) He delivers the afflicted by their affliction and opens their ear by adversity.
(Ps 23.5; 118.5; Hos 2.14) He also allured you out of distress into a broad place where there was no constraint, and what was set on your table was full of fatness.
“But you are obsessed with the case of the wicked; judgment and justice seize you.
(Job 33.24; 34.33; Jon 4.4, 9) Beware that wrath does not entice you into scoffing, and do not let the greatness of the ransom turn you aside.
Will your cry avail to keep you from distress, or will all the force of your strength?
(Job 34.20, 25) Do not long for the night, when peoples are cut off in their place.
(Ps 66.18; Heb 11.25) Beware! Do not turn to iniquity; because of that you have been tried by affliction.
See, God is exalted in his power; who is a teacher like him?
(Job 8.3; 34.13; Isa 40.13; 1 Cor 2.16) Who has prescribed for him his way, or who can say, ‘You have done wrong’?
Elihu Proclaims God’s Majesty (2 Sam 7.26; Ps 35.27; 59.16) “Remember to extol his work, of which mortals have sung.
All people have looked on it; everyone watches it from far away.
(Ps 102.24) Surely God is great, and we do not know him; the number of his years is unsearchable.
(Ps 147.8) For he draws up the drops of water; he distills (Cn: Heb they distill) his mist in rain,
which the skies pour down and drop upon mortals abundantly.
(Job 26.14; 37.11, 16) Can anyone understand the spreading of the clouds, the thunderings of his pavilion?
See, he scatters his lightning around him and covers the roots of the sea.
(Job 37.13; Ps 136.25) For by these he governs peoples; he gives food in abundance.
(Job 37.15) He covers his hands with the lightning and commands it to strike the mark.
(Job 37.2) Its crashing (Meaning of Heb uncertain) tells about him; he is jealous (Meaning of Heb uncertain) with anger against iniquity.
